derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent.: from Scottish Gaelic cabar 'pole'

entry.tran: (苏格兰传统扔掷比赛的)长而重的木柱
entry.def: A caber is a long, heavy, wooden pole. It is thrown into the air as a test of strength in the traditional Scottish sport called 'tossing the caber'.

means.word_mean: 1. a heavy wooden pole (such as the trunk of a young fir) tossed as a test of strength (in the Highlands of northern Scotland)

auth_sentence.content: I always thought this Scottish breakfast treat, strangely knobbly, was designed to shock tourists, a bit like caber-tossing.
